about: My name is Amar Shah. I am a Undergraduate student studying Math and Computer Science, with a minor in Logic, at the University of California, Berkeley. This spring I will be interning with Zhendong Su's group at ETH Zurich.
research: I am interested in building safe and verifiable software. Specifically, I aim to develop better tools for formal verifcation, programming languages, and automated reasoning.
teaching: I also really enjoy teaching, at Berkeley I have been on course staff for Math 1A: Calculus, CS 70: Discrete Math and Probability Theory, CS 170: Efficient Algorithms and Intractable Problems, and C191: Quantum Information Science and Technology
